author.bio: WPCampus is a community of web professionals, educators, and others dedicated to the growth of WordPress in higher education. Our mission is to advance colleges and universities by providing a support structure and wealth of knowledge for anyone who uses, or is interested in using, WordPress.

node.title: Help WPCampus redesign our website

node.content:
A few months ago, The WPCampus community established a redesign working group with the goal of redesigning our community’s main website: https://dev5290.wpcampus.org.

It’s been an exciting project! The amazing group has been hard at work to create a new design and establish a decoupled infrastructure using WordPress and Gatsby, a static site generator.

Complete a card sort exercise

If you’d like to be involved with the project and contribute to our community, the website redesign group could use your help.

If you have 10 minutes to spare, please help us complete a card sort exercise.

What is a card sort exercise?

Card sorting is a technique in user experience testing which is used to help design or evaluate the information architecture of a site.

We’d love to know how you would organize our website’s existing and new content for the new website’s primary navigation.

Complete the WPCampus.org card sort exercise

Join the working group for live coding

If you’re interested in how we’re developing the new website, our working group has an open “live coding” session every Wednesday at 12 p.m. Eastern time.

It’s a great opportunity to contribute and learn more about WordPress and Gatsby development.

We use Zoom to chat and code. You can access the live coding planning document for more information.
